p:
Since the number of symmetry operations of the space group Cmcm (16) is twice that of C2/ m (8), the η″ phase with the space group C2 /m should have two orientation variants if it is formed from the η phase through solid–solid phase transformation upon cooling. These two orientation variants (designated as A and B) are generated by taking the principal axis ( b-axis) of the monoclinic unit cell parallel (A) and anti-parallel (B) to the a-axis of the parent orthorhombic unit cell ( Figure 3(c)). Since these two orientation variants are symmetric with each other with respect to the (001)
Cmcm mirror plane, they are twins.
